1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (23:54): like a clamav plugin or something?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:14): I have a serious problem with samba
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:14): when my xp clients boot, they automatically map to four smb shares
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:14): checking my samba logs, almost always I have this error:
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:14): city01 (193.92.94.101) connect to service J initially as user city (uid=1001, gid=1001) (pid 4207)
0f837bed65f71cd56aa415bd4b8d237a (00:22): threat2: there's a plugin called samba-av i've heard of/read about, but never put it to the test
0f837bed65f71cd56aa415bd4b8d237a (00:23): does anyone have experience with the GOSA admin tool?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:24): it's just an example, it happens with all my clients
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:24): WiZy, I see, can I assume the network is configured properly and your router / switch is not blocking SMB packets within your network?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:25): I actually replaced an old w2k server with samba yesterday
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:25): new box, debian sarge and sid gives the same
0f837bed65f71cd56aa415bd4b8d237a (00:26): threat2: seems like a very nice LDAP/Samba user admin tool with a GUI interface, but can't get it to work..got a nasty LDAP error which i can't get rid of
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:27): WiZy, no idea :)  but apparantly something isn't implemented :)
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:27): WiZy, what version are you using?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:27): it has been reported since 2002 here and there but no appropriate answer, ever, no replies at all
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:30): could it be a problem related to the hard disks?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:30): I mean, I use sata disks for the shares
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:30): WiZy, you want to paste your smb.conf file somewhere?  like nopaste, or rafb/paste, or someplace like that
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:31): then again samba knows nothing that low level :)
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:32): as long as you have the kernel module for your controller card and filesystem it will work :)  samba just uses the API system calls to access the disk
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:32): yes I know, but I don't know what else to think
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:33): I 've thought that this could be related to a bottleneck
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:33): WiZy, your clients have the same subnet mask too as the samba server?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:33): but I don't know.. sata works fine though
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:34): the only odd thing is that the box's hostname is different than the netbios name I use in samba
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:34): WiZy, you have a firewall blocking people connecting to your samba server right?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:34): but all the terminals are in my lan
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:34): where there is no firewall at all
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:34): because null passwords = Yes would be dicey otherwise
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:34): WiZy: that error simply implies that xp is asking for something that samba hasn't implemented.  what is the side effect of the error?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:35): ||cw: it usually happens when windows try to map network shares when they boot
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:35): WiZy, all of your client computers use the username city?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:35): yes, and if I access Z: for example after the error, I finally get connected
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:36): but the problem is that in my terminals' installation I use these maps to load start menu and shortcuts
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:36): so, when the error occures (on boot time) i have no shortcuts until I kill explorer.exe to reload them
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:36): I do that too, I haven't gone looking for errors, but I don't have a problem in login scripts either
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:36): i don't use any login scripts
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:36): well I am off to sleep now
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:37): the sun is starting to come up :P
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:37): goodbye threat2 and thanks for your time
1b51569779af61ca040906ebfd79ab19 (00:37): I tried :)  I havnt read all of the book yet :P
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:38): i just can't figure out what is _not_ implemented.. as I don't have any special requirement from samba..
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:42): how do you do this without a login script?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:43): and i then map i: to \\blah\desktop
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:44): and where does I get mapped?
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:44): to a smb share (on a sata disk)
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:44): I do have my documents remapped, but I map the driver with a login script
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:44): I found the domain driver mapping unreliable, and that is with a real NT4 PDC
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:45): i don't think that this is the problem because I have more errors (maybe related to the one above)
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:45): i.e. after the drive has mapped properly
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:45): at some time I have this in the logs:
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:45): Oplock break failed for file city/images/cod2.jpg -- replying anyway
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:45): Oplock break failed for file city/images/coffee.jpg -- replying anyway
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:46): kernel oplocks should work just fine
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:47): i really don't know what to do to even debug this issue
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:49): I just disabled oplocks from smb.conf
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:49): as long as there is only one client on the files, oplocks arne't much of a problem
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:50): city01 (193.92.94.101) connect to service J initially as user city (uid=1001, gid=1001) (pid 4351)
24c06ed728be1a262a97095a9728c157 (00:50): well, I don't understand, why it keeps on complaining about J
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:51): this might be better asked on the mailing list, it's pretty technical.  maybe a higher log level would have more clue
